work.title: IT Cybersecurity Specialist
work.org: Department of Justice — U.S. Trustee Program
work.description: Providing cybersecurity oversight across DOJ mission-critical systems. Implementing enterprise security protocols, incident response procedures, and DLP strategies aligned with NIST frameworks. Leading integration and QA for new deployments including cloud infrastructure and application environments.

work.title: Summer Research Program Intern
work.description: Designed software and hardware methodologies to evaluate cybersecurity resiliency of control systems and infrastructure interfaces. Developed protocol parsers for ICS and proprietary network protocols to improve monitoring and defense.

work.title: Cybersecurity Research Intern
work.description: Analyzed cybersecurity risks for NASA's Next Generation Network (NGN), focusing on integrating commercial cloud platforms. Reviewed and adapted methods to align with NIST 800-53/800-171 for NGN architecture.

work.title: Cybersecurity Intern
work.description: Executed critical service updates with cybersecurity best practices. Integrated modern technologies to improve infrastructure agility. Leveraged Teleport, ThreatConnect, and OpenShift to fortify infrastructure security.

work.title: Senior Cybersecurity Intern
work.description: Developed and implemented security protocols for NASA's SCaN Cloud in alignment with federal policies and standards. Produced security artifacts and documentation to support independent assessments.

work.title: Information Security Intern → Student Worker
work.description: Conducted application security assessments using DAST/SAST tools (OWASP ZAP, Burp Suite, Checkmarx, Acunetix) mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. Led offensive assessments and penetration tests on communication platforms. Used Splunk and Zscaler in red-team exercises.

work.title: Tech Fellow
work.description: Led and taught the Cybersecurity course at the University of Maryland. Conducted weekly sessions, organized learning material, and mentored students in defensive application security.

work.title: Cryptography Intern → Security Intern
work.description: Implemented CCSDS SDLS-EP to secure spacecraft-ground communications via NOS3. Analyzed cryptographic mechanisms and mission requirements. Enhanced security compliance tooling and assessed NCCS infrastructures across multiple frameworks.

work.title: Networking / System Administration Intern
work.description: Configured advanced network devices and managed diverse OS/hardware used in NASA infrastructure. Deployed a secure, service-rich private network infrastructure.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
highlights: Minors: Cybersecurity (ACES), Science, Technology, Ethics & Policy
FIRE Program: AI & Deep Learning, Capital One ML stream
Cybersecurity Club Secretary, NCL Team, NCCDC Team

publications.title: SocialCipher: A Multimodal Framework for Proactive Threat Detection with SentIntel
publications.description: Co-authored paper on proactive cyber threat detection using sentiment analysis and LLMs. Research conducted at MIT Lincoln Laboratory.

publications.title: Geneva — Protocol Obfuscation Research
publications.description: Researching utilization of Text-to-Speech quirks for practical applications in circumventing censorship detection mechanisms. Establishing baselines for detectability vs throughput optimization.

publications.title: Cyber Threat Intelligence Research
publications.description: Spearheaded threat intelligence on APTs 40 and 41. Developed comprehensive threat profiles and delivered high-impact briefing to NSA leadership with actionable intelligence.
